It's not really anything too surprising. Most countries in Europe that were affected by Chernobyl still have controls in place. In Germany for example all boars that get shot are tested before being sold. It's an easy way to test how high the radiation still is as Caesium (the most common radioactive isotope today) accumulates in boar during their lifetime because mushrooms are a part of a boar's diet.
